page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content:
There are two parish churches in the survey area, Loddiswell with its church St. Michael and All Angels, and Woodleigh with St. Mary's. They are both ancient buildings built of the local stone but with some granite from Dartmoor in the structure. Congregations tend to be rather small and the vicar also tends two other churches, at Moreleigh and Halwell. However there is a rota so that each of the four churches has a service each Sunday, either Holy Communion, a Family Service or Evening Prayer.
In Loddiswell there is a large and quite well attended Congregational Church or Chapel, built in the middle of the 19th century. There are two services each Sunday, at 11am and 6.30pm.
